meanings.definition: To hinder or prevent the progress or accomplishment of something.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain was stymying our picnic plans.
meanings.sent2: The closed road stymied our journey to the beach.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stymied our attempts to set up the tent.
meanings.sent4: The tangled wires stymied our efforts to fix the broken lamp.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog stymied our visibility, making it hard to navigate.

meanings.definition: To block or thwart someone's efforts or plans.
meanings.sent1: The locked door stymied our escape from the room.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected delay stymied their chances of reaching the airport on time.
meanings.sent3: The clever disguise stymied their attempt at a surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The sudden power outage stymied their presentation at the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise stymied their concentration, causing them to lose focus.
